inputMode.name: inputMode
inputMode.description:
Hints at the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents
@see https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/interaction.html#input-modalities:-the-inputmode-attribute

is.name: is
is.description:
Specify that a standard HTML element should behave like a defined custom built-in element
@see https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/custom-elements.html#attr-is

aria-activedescendant.name: aria-activedescendant
aria-activedescendant.description: Identifies the currently active element when DOM focus is on a composite widget, textbox, group, or application.

aria-atomic.name: aria-atomic
aria-atomic.description: Indicates whether assistive technologies will present all, or only parts of, the changed region based on the change notifications defined by the aria-relevant attribute.

aria-autocomplete.name: aria-autocomplete
aria-autocomplete.description:
Indicates whether inputting text could trigger display of one or more predictions of the user's intended value for an input and specifies how predictions would be
presented if they are made.

aria-busy.name: aria-busy
aria-busy.description: Indicates an element is being modified and that assistive technologies MAY want to wait until the modifications are complete before exposing them to the user.

aria-checked.name: aria-checked

aria-colcount.name: aria-colcount
aria-colcount.description:
Defines the total number of columns in a table, grid, or treegrid.
@see aria-colindex.

aria-colindex.name: aria-colindex

aria-colspan.name: aria-colspan

aria-controls.name: aria-controls
aria-controls.description:
Identifies the element (or elements) whose contents or presence are controlled by the current element.
@see aria-owns.

aria-current.name: aria-current
aria-current.description: Indicates the element that represents the current item within a container or set of related elements.

aria-describedby.name: aria-describedby
aria-describedby.description:
Identifies the element (or elements) that describes the object.
@see aria-labelledby

aria-details.name: aria-details
aria-details.description:
Identifies the element that provides a detailed, extended description for the object.
@see aria-describedby.

aria-disabled.name: aria-disabled

aria-dropeffect.name: aria-dropeffect
aria-dropeffect.description:
Indicates what functions can be performed when a dragged object is released on the drop target.
@deprecated in ARIA 1.1

aria-errormessage.name: aria-errormessage

aria-expanded.name: aria-expanded
aria-expanded.description: Indicates whether the element, or another grouping element it controls, is currently expanded or collapsed.

aria-flowto.name: aria-flowto
aria-flowto.description:
Identifies the next element (or elements) in an alternate reading order of content which, at the user's discretion,
allows assistive technology to override the general default of reading in document source order.

aria-grabbed.name: aria-grabbed
aria-grabbed.description:
Indicates an element's "grabbed" state in a drag-and-drop operation.
@deprecated in ARIA 1.1

aria-haspopup.name: aria-haspopup
aria-haspopup.description: Indicates the availability and type of interactive popup element, such as menu or dialog, that can be triggered by an element.

aria-hidden.name: aria-hidden
aria-hidden.description:
Indicates whether the element is exposed to an accessibility API.
@see aria-disabled.

aria-invalid.name: aria-invalid
aria-invalid.description:
Indicates the entered value does not conform to the format expected by the application.
@see aria-errormessage.

aria-keyshortcuts.name: aria-keyshortcuts
aria-keyshortcuts.description: Indicates keyboard shortcuts that an author has implemented to activate or give focus to an element.

aria-label.name: aria-label
aria-label.description:
Defines a string value that labels the current element.
@see aria-labelledby.

aria-labelledby.name: aria-labelledby
aria-labelledby.description:
Identifies the element (or elements) that labels the current element.
@see aria-describedby.

aria-level.name: aria-level
aria-level.description: Defines the hierarchical level of an element within a structure.

aria-live.name: aria-live
aria-live.description: Indicates that an element will be updated, and describes the types of updates the user agents, assistive technologies, and user can expect from the live region.

aria-modal.name: aria-modal
aria-modal.description: Indicates whether an element is modal when displayed.

aria-multiline.name: aria-multiline
aria-multiline.description: Indicates whether a text box accepts multiple lines of input or only a single line.

aria-multiselectable.name: aria-multiselectable
aria-multiselectable.description: Indicates that the user may select more than one item from the current selectable descendants.

aria-orientation.name: aria-orientation
aria-orientation.description: Indicates whether the element's orientation is horizontal, vertical, or unknown/ambiguous.

aria-owns.name: aria-owns

aria-placeholder.name: aria-placeholder
aria-placeholder.description:
Defines a short hint (a word or short phrase) intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value.
A hint could be a sample value or a brief description of the expected format.

aria-posinset.name: aria-posinset
aria-posinset.description:
Defines an element's number or position in the current set of listitems or treeitems. Not required if all elements in the set are present in the DOM.
@see aria-setsize.

aria-pressed.name: aria-pressed

aria-readonly.name: aria-readonly
aria-readonly.description:
Indicates that the element is not editable, but is otherwise operable.
@see aria-disabled.

aria-relevant.name: aria-relevant
aria-relevant.description:
Indicates what notifications the user agent will trigger when the accessibility tree within a live region is modified.
@see aria-atomic.

aria-required.name: aria-required
aria-required.description: Indicates that user input is required on the element before a form may be submitted.

aria-roledescription.name: aria-roledescription
aria-roledescription.description: Defines a human-readable, author-localized description for the role of an element.

aria-rowcount.name: aria-rowcount
aria-rowcount.description:
Defines the total number of rows in a table, grid, or treegrid.
@see aria-rowindex.

aria-rowindex.name: aria-rowindex

aria-rowspan.name: aria-rowspan

aria-selected.name: aria-selected

aria-setsize.name: aria-setsize
aria-setsize.description:
Defines the number of items in the current set of listitems or treeitems. Not required if all elements in the set are present in the DOM.
@see aria-posinset.

aria-sort.name: aria-sort
aria-sort.description: Indicates if items in a table or grid are sorted in ascending or descending order.

aria-valuemax.name: aria-valuemax
aria-valuemax.description: Defines the maximum allowed value for a range widget.

aria-valuemin.name: aria-valuemin
aria-valuemin.description: Defines the minimum allowed value for a range widget.

aria-valuenow.name: aria-valuenow
aria-valuenow.description:
Defines the current value for a range widget.
@see aria-valuetext.

aria-valuetext.name: aria-valuetext
aria-valuetext.description: Defines the human readable text alternative of aria-valuenow for a range widget.
